content.description: Wave Hugging is funky and fun. There is no swinging wildly on this one as the rock behind you will keep you honest. Sit start with a high right heel and two small but good crimps. Move up through more crimps to a pretty good hold on the lip.
content.location: This is a little hard to find, but it is probably easiest to approach from the Schoolhouse Boulder. If standing at the uphill side of the Schoolhouse Boulder, look straight West for a big (~30 feet high), easy slab that can be climbed for the most direct access route. Otherwise, find a way to the top of the broken cliff band, and position yourself so you can look down at the Schoolhouse Boulder. Now look around for a slot in the rocks that forms a subtle wave shape. The climb is gently overhung with a steep slab right behind you as you climb.

content.description:
Start matched on a slopey crimp rail, and head straight up, with an interesting topout.

It is best to climb this in the fall to spring before the tree starts sprouting leaves.

I gave it the name The South, because the first hold reminded me of The South. Let me know the FA info if you have it.
content.protection: A pad or two and a person to hold the tree back in order to do the topout.
content.location:
This is on the north side of the same boulder with

Proper English

and Dionysian Ecstasy.

content.description: On the West side of the Schoolhouse Boulder lies this left to right traverse. It looks easy, but it's a little tricky! Pick the path of least resistance through beautiful, rounded cracks, stay the course when the bottom drops out, make a big reach (crux), and round the corner.
content.protection: Bring a pad and a buddy or buddette.
content.location: This is in the Schoolyard Area, above The Caves, on the Dark Side in Morrison.

content.description: Start on two crimps, and make some dynamic moves through okay ledges up to the lip. Then throw a high heel, and pull a difficult mantel to bomber jugs. Stopping at the lip would bump this down to around V3, so top out for full credit.
content.location:
Start as for

Wave Hugging

, but move left up the lip.

content.description:
This variant of

The Doubloon

starts on a positive, slightly gaston, left-facing crimp and the flat-ish rail that is the start foot for the stand start. From here, two moves on awkward feet gain you the start hold of

The Doubloon

. Finish as such.
content.location:
See the directions on

Wave Hugging

.

content.description: Start sitting, then move up and right through the scoop.
content.location: This is high on the ridge line, above The Caves, in the Schoolyard Area. The boulder sits by itself and has an obvious scoop on the west face.
